channel.title: The iPad
channel.description:
Okay. Apple has just released the iPad in one of the states in Australia and the rest will follow suite soon. This made me curious and I had a little look into it. Am I the only one who thinks that it is rediculous? Absolutely useless form of technology. Think about it; Apple has released so many products to change the normal work flow. They revolutionized and attempted to replace good forms of hardware and software into more efficient products. Such as:
iPod - Replacement for MP3 players Macbooks/iMac - Replacing Microsoft iPhone - Replacing touch camera phones iMouse - Replacing normal mouses iPad - Replacing what?
And by replacement I don't mean taking over, I mean just revolutionizing. So what do you guys think? Is it a useless form of technology?

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

Phaze One:

And if you think about it, the application store has to be completely re-made for a useless product. Good one Apple.

It can either scale up apps automatically, or have them with a border around the edge - according to their website iirc.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

What really fucking irritates me about the iPad is that is has mainstream media outlets fooled. If your not a techie you have no idea what you are actually buying and Apple is taking advantage of that and selling it as a ‘new generation laptop.’

As for mainstream media being fooled, today I turned on the news and see: “Canadians going crazy for the iPad”.

My opinion: OVERRATED!

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:23, topic:341570”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=437970.msg3219785#msg3219785 date=1275082471]

Buy an iPad and the rock.
Drop the Rock on the iPad. Problem Solved.
Don’t under-esimated the power of the rock. The cavemen only had rocks why can’t we?

What’s the point of buying a $500 iPad and breaking it…? That ‘solves’ nothing at all, lol.

The same reason people bought a $600 PS3 the day it came out and proceeded to bash the hell out of it with a baseball bat in front of 6000 people then post it on YouTube… to piss off fanboys…
[/quote]
Thanks! At least I “make sense” to someone.
jk lol[/quote]

i watched the smashmywii video on youtube, didnt see the smashmyps3 or 360 video though

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I haven’t done much research on the iPad because I have no intention on buying one, but from what I can tell it’s an over sized iPod Touch.

Though, the iPad sounds like what you buy when another one of Apple’s products goes on its period.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Chassy13:

My first opinion seeing the iPad advertised was I thought it was a joke. How often would you want to carry around a huge screen, when instead you could get a laptop with a carrying case or something. As Lin said, you can’t even fold it down for screen protection. Perhaps if the price was a lot less, it would be almost worth it.

if you think about it, they make all their portable shit really flimsy, i think they released a laptop or something that was incredibly thin. Really stupid, if you drop it, 80% chance itll snap.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The iPad is the biggest rip off I’ve ever seen in the market, and I’m being completely honest. Let’s face it: It’s too big to fit in your pocket and too big to be a laptop and carried in a case. It can’t be folded for screen protection, doesn’t beat the laptop’s battery life by too much, and is only there for cheap games. It has very low specs compared to a laptop, and a smaller screen. It gets sold for $500 according to the last time I checked Apple’s site, which is more than the price of a laptop that beats the iPad’s specs in every way possible.

This is a shitty tool that was only made to fool people into feeding Apple money.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

And honestly. It’s the size of an A4 page. You sit there with a laptop resting on your knees or on a desk typing away or you listen to music with your iPod touch in your pocket. Neither of that can be done with the iPad. You would need a briefcase to carry it around and the annoyance of having to lean over the screen while it’s lying on a desk to reduce glare would be infuriating.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Ironically this page is showing iPad cases as the advert at the top :P.

The iPad is basically just a larger version of the iPod touch, with a better looking UI. There’s not much more you can do on the iPad than on the iPod Touch.

Read full topic
